meanings.definition: Relating to both space and time.
meanings.sent1: The spatiotemporal map showed how things change over time and space.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the spatiotemporal patterns of migration in birds.
meanings.sent3: The spatiotemporal dance performance beautifully blended movements through space and time.
meanings.sent4: Her spatiotemporal artwork captured the essence of a moment frozen in time and space.
meanings.sent5: The spatiotemporal concept of a wormhole connecting distant galaxies fascinated the students.

meanings.definition: Involving both spatial and temporal aspects.
meanings.sent1: The spatiotemporal analysis considered how events unfold in both space and time.
meanings.sent2: The book explored the spatiotemporal relationship between history and geography.
meanings.sent3: The spatiotemporal puzzle required players to solve clues across different time periods and locations.
meanings.sent4: His spatiotemporal theory connected the dots between past occurrences and future possibilities.
